title: Galaxy Nails! 5 Galaxy Nail Art Designs & Ideas

json.text: Hello everybody!
I have a nail art video for you today.
And there won't be just one design, but five!

Yes, five different nail art designs and techniques
inspired by the galaxy.
So these were the designs that I created...
Ok, let's turn the lights on.

So you can choose just one design and pain
all of your nails in that one like I did on
this hand or you can mix different techniques.

So if you are interested on how to achieve
these designs let's get started with the tutorial.

Galaxy nails are extremely popular right now,
so here I am showing you my 5 different takes
on the galaxy nail art.
First let's create a Milky Way design.

To start of protect all of your nails with
a base coat.

Especially darker polish colors can stain
your natural nail, so this step is very important.

Apply a black polish for a dark night sky
effect.

Take a little piece of cosmetic sponge and
some tweezers.

Dip the sponge in the dark blue polish and
create an oval shape down the diagonal of
your nail.

Start adding stars, by dipping the sponge
into the fine milled glitter polish and apply
it on top of the blue one.
On top, go for a lighter blue polish.
Apply it down the center of the oval shape.

You want the darker blue still peeking out
on the sides for a gradient effect.

Milky Way is like a band of light made of
stars.

It contains billions of stars that cannot
be distinguished with a naked eye and that's

why the center is of very light white to bright
yellow color.

First, apply a white thin band of stars and
then go in with a yellow color creating a

bright stripe down the center of our Milky
Way.

The Milky Way is a galaxy that contains our
solar system.

It appears as a milky glowing band arching
across the night sky.

Apply some fine milled glitter top coat and
our first design is finished.
I think we started out great, didn't we?

The next is this super cute full moon in the
night sky design.

Start off with a dark blue color and apply
a transparent glitter polish on top for some
sparkle.

Moon is the only natural satellite of the
Earth.

To create a moon you can use a large dotting
tool or an eraser on the back of a pencil
like me.

Dip the eraser in white polish and just dot
it on your nail.

See how you can create a perfect circle with
a pencil!

To get a light grey color mix white polish
with a dot of a black one like so!

Randomly dab some of this color on the moon
with a toothpick.

If you look at the moon closely you would
notice that it is not of solid white color

but it has hints of lighter and darker grey
because of the craters on its surface.
Next we want to add some bright stars.

I am drawing two larger ones with a striper
dipped into white polish.
Just make a simple cross shape like so.

I think this design would look great as an
accent nail on your ring finger, when you're

wearing dark blue or even black polish on
your nails.

The stars that are further away appear as
small dots of sparkle, so make several white
dots allover with a toothpick.

Finnish the design with a fast drying top
coat.
For the third design I am creating a nebula.

Nebula is an interstellar cloud of dust, hydrogen
and other gases from which sun, planets and
stars were formed.
Begin by applying a coat of black polish.

With a sponge tap on dark blue color patches
randomly throughout your nail.

Take a lighter blue polish and apply it over
some dark blue areas.
You don't want to cover the dark blue completely.
Nebulas appear like colored clouds.

Therefore take a violet polish and make some
patches with it.
You can also add a bit of pink.

What really brings the design together is
the glittery top coat.
Mine has some fine and some bigger glitter.
I am applying a coat of that.

If you don't get enough larger glitters on,
you can add them manually.

I'll show you how to catch the bigger stars
later on.

For now, let's finish our Nebula nails with
a fast drying top coat.

This one was so easy to create and I love
how it turned out!

You can also create galaxy nail art designs
using the water marbling technique.

I am first applying a dark blue polish as
a base.

This will assure that no matter what color
I'll use for water marbling, the color on
my nails will come out much darker.

Protect the finger around your nail with a
tape.
This way you we'll have less cleaning afterwards.

If you're new to water marbling I have a video
on my channel, which explains this technique
step by step with all the tips and tricks.
So make sure to check it out!

Pour some water in the cup and pick any colors
of polish that remind you of galaxy.

I went for some white, orange and blue since
I want to create a galactic center which is
very bright.

Drop the polishes in the water like so and
make several swirls.

You don't really need a precise pattern, there's
a lot of chaos when it comes to sky and stars.

Choose a spot you like the most and dip in
your finger.

Leave the finger in for few seconds and in
the meantime clean the polish from the surface.
Carefully pull the finger out of the water.

Remove the tape and clean any polish from
your finger with a q-tip soaked in acetone.

Apply a glitter polish on top and add some
larger glitters one by one to make the design
look bolder.

As you can see the colors appear much darker,
this is because of the darker color, which
I used for the base.

Lastly protect your nail with a fast drying
top coat.

Water marble nail art is always so much fun
to create, don't you think?

The last galaxy inspired design is this lovely
gradient galactic sky.
Again, apply a coat of black polish.

Note that you'll need at least two tones of
blue and a white color to create a gradient.

Dip the sponge in the darker blue first and
apply it on the three quarters of the nail
like this.

Then apply the lighter blue on the bottom
half of the nail.

Lastly go in with white and tap the color
just on the tip of the nail.

Now we need to decorate this galactic sky
with some stars.

I am using polish that contains small and
large pieces of glitter.
I am applying a coat of this.
As you can see I got only one bigger glitter.

But I want more stars so here's how you can
catch them.

Just use a toothpick and pick one by one from
the polish brush and then you can place it
exactly where you want it.
I want a lot of sparkle as you can tell.

Once you're happy secure the design with a
fast drying top coat.

For thousands of years human has been looking
out into space, into millions of sparkly stars
in the night sky.

Trying to understand how we are connected,
how it all began and where is the future taking
us.

I really hope you liked this galaxy nail art
tutorial.

I think galaxy nails are very cool and so
much fun.
They are also quite easy and simple to create!

So this were my five nail art designs inspired
by the galaxy.

I honestly can't decide which one is my favorite
because I love them all!
But let me know which one do you prefer?!

And also if you decide to recreate one of
these designs send them to me on Instagram,
Twitter or Facebook.

Thank you so much for watching and see you
next time.
Bye bye.
